website_summaries.verdict: Though it feels well-built and has a handy kickstand, the Lenovo Yoga Tablet’s poor performance makes it hard to justify even at its low cost.
pros: The Lenovo Yoga Tablet 8's super-slim, unique design makes it easy to hold
cons: The tablet’s low-resolution screen is dull and the heavily modified operating system is downright ugly

customer_reviews.title: Lenovo Yoga Tablet -
customer_reviews.text: These were used for door prizes and the recipients were enthralled. The price on this tablet is affordable - it was more than $100 less than the next generation. The size is that it will fit comfortably into a smaller handbag or brief case. I have been an IBM fan and continued on with Lenovo when they took over that division of IBM. Their customer service is great.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Mooney

customer_reviews.title: No Connectivity to Wifi Whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Bought this refurbished and the wifi was never able to connect. I researched for a while trying to see if I could solve the problem but it was actually a common problem with these tablets, and I would most likely need to get a new one.

customer_reviews.title: Love it. It seems like a novelty
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It seems like a novelty, but the thick base really makes a difference. The only negative is that some games, even casual ones, need more RAM to run properly.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a home tablet

I use it for my home automation setup and just general use at home. I also have a iPad but this device seems to work perfectly at home for what I need it for. The kick stand is such a simple yet affective idea as it actually looks like it's meant to be on the coffee table or bench when charging. am currently looking for the 4g version as I think I would like to try to start using it as a every day tablet. Perfect size and great look and feel.

Bought this as a gift to my family back in India(from Best buy as they are selling it for 165$ on Clearance) ...am planning to buy one for myself. Also found it very convenient to read my kindle book because of the cylindrical bulge ; which helps to hold the tablet comfortably(opening up the kick-stand adds more convenience :) ). The screen resolution is more than enough for an 8 inch screen and found the videos and pictures to be clear. Will definitely recommend.

customer_reviews.title: SD card only works in FAT32 format.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed when I realized that the SD card would only work if it was in FAT32 format. As a result, you can only put very small files (less than two gigabytes) on it. Also, I could not get any support from Lenovo. I had to figure this out for myself. I have gotten much better technical support from Dell and HP in the past. Another thing I found out is that this machine will not work with *.WTV files.
customer_reviews.author: J. Busa

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st Lenov tablet and I realy love it. The IPS disply is clear and very responsive. Thanks for the quad core processor, it runs fast and provides high performance,especially after upgrading system to 4.4.2. The sound quality and battery life is better than iPad Air. I am a heavy user on broswering. The battery holds near 14 hours from a full charge. I'd recommend this tablet if you are looking for a decent tablet with a long time battery life for this price. Highly recommended.
